page.title: 03CULWORTH HOUSES OF INTEREST
page.content: CULWORTH MILL Present building believed to be C17.It is in the process of being extensively renovated to provide a large four bedroomed madern house. CULWORTH HALL Present owner Mr C Hill,who has lived there for 25yrs.Mr Hill's father was the rector of Culworth so he had previously lived in the Old Rectory. There is a marble fireplace exactly the same as one in the Old Rectory. CULWORTH HOUSE A very large imposing house with a beautiful garden overlooking fields.Probably built around 1750,remodelled since. CULWORTH MANOR House C17,original home of the D'Anvers family.King Charles 1 spent the night here in 1644.In 1985 it is divided into 3 homes.
